form.IN:
Pretekli deležnik glagola
go
je večinoma ‘gone’, pri pomenih od 1 do 4 pa včasih uporabljamo tudi ‘been’: glej
been
.

sense.def:
To go somewhere
pomeni zapustiti neki kraj in se premakniti ali odpotovati nekam drugam.

seg.quote: I went to Stockholm.
‘I must go,’ she said.
She went into the sitting-room.
He went to get some fresh milk.
Our train went at 2.25.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
go
povemo, da sodelujemo pri neki dejavnosti.

seg.quote: Let's go fishing.
They went for a walk.

sense.def:
To go and do a particular thing
pomeni premakniti se z enega kraja na drugega, da bi storili nekaj določenega.

seg.quote: I'll go and see him in the morning.

sense.def:
To go to school, church, or work
pomeni redno obiskovati šolo, cerkev ali delo.

seg.quote: She went to London University for three years.

sense.def:
Če neka cesta
goes somewhere
, pelje v neki kraj.

seg.quote: There's a little road that goes off to the right.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
go
lahko tudi povemo, da se nekaj spremeni ali postane nekaj drugega. Na primer:
one's hair is going grey
pomeni, da lasje neke osebe postajajo sivi.

seg.quote: The village thought we had gone crazy.
The average age of farmers has gone down.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
go
povemo, da se nekdo odloči, da bo v določenem stanju. Na primer, če nekdo
is going naked
, na sebi nima oblačil.
Go
v tem pomenu pogosto uporabljamo z besedami z zanikanim pomenom.

seg.quote: Halliday's absence had gone unnoticed.
Her decision went unchallenged.

sense.def:
Z besedo
go
tudi povemo, kako poteka določeni dogodek, dejavnost ali obdobje.

seg.quote: How did school go?
Everything went pretty smoothly.
The days went by slowly.

sense.def:
Kadar stroj ali naprava
is going
, deluje.

seg.quote: The tape recorder was still going.

sense.def:
Kadar zvonec ali alarm
goes
, se oglasi.

Kadar nekaj
is going
ali
has gone
, ne deluje več.

seg.quote: Her eyesight is going.
I think the batteries must have gone.

sense.def:
Kadar denar ali sredstva
go into or on something
, z njimi nekaj podpremo ali financiramo, na primer načrt ali projekt.

seg.quote: Most of the aid has gone into urban projects.
40% of his income goes on rent.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
goes to someone
, je tisto nekomu dano.

seg.quote: The job is to go to a private contractor.

sense.def:
Kadar dve stvari
go together
, se ujemata ali sta primerni druga za drugo.

seg.quote: I got the shoes to go with my coat.
The colours go so very well together.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
goes in a particular place
, se prilega določenemu kraju ali sodi tja.

seg.quote: The silencer went on easily.
Where do the pans go?

sense.def:
Izraz
go
lahko uporabimo pred besedo, ki ponazarja glas, ali preden nekaj navedemo.

seg.quote: As the song goes: I fell in love with eyes of blue.
...American sirens which instead of going ‘Ow-wow’ go ‘Whoop-whoop’.

sense.def:
A go
je poskus, da bi nekaj naredili.

seg.quote: He passed the test first go.
I'll have a go at mending it.

sense.def:
Kadar je določena stvar
to go
, jo je treba še opraviti. Kadar je določeno obdobje
to go
, še ni minilo.

seg.quote: There are still two years to go.

sense.def:
There goes a particular thing
rečemo, da izrazimo razočaranje, ker določene stvari ne moremo imeti;

seg.quote: There goes my chance of a job.

sense.def:
Kadar rečemo, da nekaj
goes to show something interesting
ali
goes to prove something interesting
, hočemo povedati, da nekaj kaže ali dokazuje nekaj zanimivega.

seg.quote: All of which goes to show that people haven't changed.

sense.def:
To have a go at someone
pomeni nekoga kritizirati;

cit.quote: spraviti se na koga, lotiti se koga

sense.def:
Če se nekaj dogaja
from the word go
, se v določenih okoliščinah dogaja ves čas.

seg.quote: She complained from the word go.

sense.def:
Če imamo določeni projekt ali dejavnost
on the go
, se ukvarjamo z njo ali smo vpleteni vanjo.

seg.quote: She's always got several schemes on the go.

sense.def:
To go about a task or one's usual activities
pomeni ukvarjati se z neko nalogo ali običajnimi dejavnostmi.

seg.quote: She told me how to go about it.

sense.def:
To go after something
pomeni poskusiti nekaj dobiti.

seg.quote: My husband had gone after a job.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
goes against an idea
, je v nasprotju z neko zamislijo.

seg.quote: When things go against my wishes, I threaten to resign.

sense.def:
To go against someone's advice
pomeni storiti nekaj drugega kot tisto, kar od nas želijo.

seg.quote: She went against the advice of her Cabinet and called a general election.

sense.def:
Kadar neka odločitev
goes against someone
, na primer na sodišču, prizadeta oseba izgubi.

To go ahead with a plan or idea
pomeni začeti izpeljavo nekega načrta ali zamisli.

seg.quote: They are going ahead with the missile.
‘Would you like to hear it?’—‘Go ahead.’

sense.def:
Kadar neka organizirana prireditev
goes ahead
, se dogaja.

seg.quote: The May Day marches could go ahead.

sense.def:
To go along with a decision or idea
pomeni sprejeti in upoštevati neko odločitev ali zamisel.

seg.quote: How could you go along with such a plan?

sense.def:
To go around
,
to go round
ali
to go about doing something
pomeni imeti navado delati nekaj takega, česar drugi ne odobravajo.

seg.quote: I don't go around deliberately hurting people's feelings.

sense.def:
To go around
,
to go round
ali
to go about with a person or group of people
pomeni redno se srečevati s skupino ljudi kot s prijatelji.

seg.quote: He had no intention of letting her go around with those scruffy students.

sense.def:
Kadar novica ali šala
is going around
,
is going round
ali
is going about
, jo pripoveduje veliko ljudi.

To go back on a promise
pomeni ne storiti tistega, kar smo obljubili.

cit.quote: ne izpolniti obljube, ne držati besede

sense.def:
To go back to a task or a particular topic
pomeni znova začeti nekaj delati ali govoriti o nečem.

seg.quote: She had gone back to staring out of the window.
Going back to your point about standards, I agree that they have fallen.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
goes back to a particular time in the past
, to pomeni, da je bilo narejeno ali zgrajeno ob določenem času v preteklosti.

seg.quote: The shop goes back to 1707.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
has gone before
, se je že prej zgodilo ali so o tistem že razpravljali.

seg.quote: The meeting was unlike any that had gone before.

sense.def:
Če neko obdobje
has gone by
, je minilo.

seg.quote: Eight years went by and the children grew up.

sense.def:
To go by something
pomeni uporabiti nekaj kot podlago za oceno ali dejanje.

seg.quote: I try to go by reason as far as possible.

sense.def:
Če neka količina ali raven
goes down
, postane manjša.

cit.quote: zmanjšati se, znižati se, spustiti se

seg.quote: The average age of farmers has gone down.

sense.def:
Kadar govor ali predstava
goes down well
, je ljudem všeč.

Kadar sonce
goes down
, zaide.

To go down with an illness
pomeni dobiti neko bolezen.

To go for a particular type of product or method
pomeni izbrati določeno vrsto izdelka ali metode.

seg.quote: ...a tendency to go for grand projects.

sense.def:
To go for someone
pomeni nekoga napasti.

seg.quote: He went for me with the bread-knife.

sense.def:
Če neka trditev o osebi ali predmetu
goes for another
, je resnična tudi za drugo osebo ali predmet.

seg.quote: The same goes for Bardolph.

sense.def:
To go in for something
pomeni skleniti, da bomo nekaj redno počeli ali dobivali.

seg.quote: I thought of going in for teaching.
They go in for vintage port.

sense.def:
To go into something
pomeni nekaj podrobno opisati ali preučiti.

seg.quote: I won't go into what I've suffered.

sense.def:
To go into a particular occupation
pomeni skleniti, da bomo nekaj opravljali kot svoj poklic.

cit.quote: lotiti se, ukvarjati se s čim

seg.quote: Have you ever thought of going into journalism?

sense.def:
Kadar količina časa, truda ali denarja
goes into something
, pripomore k nastanku nečesa.

cit.quote: biti potreben ali uporabljen za kaj

seg.quote: Three years of research went into the making of those films.

sense.def:
Če neko vozilo
goes into a particular movement
, se začne premikati na določen način.

seg.quote: The plane went into a nose dive.

sense.def:
To go off someone or something
pomeni, da nekoga nimamo več radi.

seg.quote: He's suddenly gone off the idea.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
goes off
, eksplodira ali ustvari nenaden močan zvok.

seg.quote: I could hear the bombs going off.
The alarm went off.

sense.def:
Kadar neka naprava ali stroj
goes off
, preneha delovati.

seg.quote: The light only goes off at night.

sense.def:
To go off with something
pomeni s seboj odnesti nekaj, kaj pripada drugemu človeku.

seg.quote: She had let him go off with her papers.

sense.def:
To go on doing something
pomeni še naprej nekaj delati.

seg.quote: I went on writing.
They can't go on with their examinations.

sense.def:
To go on to do something
pomeni nekaj narediti, potem ko smo naredili nekaj drugega.

seg.quote: He went on to get his degree.

sense.def:
To go on to a place
pomeni iti nekam s kraja, ki smo ga že dosegli.

seg.quote: We had gone on to Clare's house.

sense.def:
To go on
pomeni govoriti naprej.

seg.quote: ‘You know,’ he went on, ‘it's extraordinary.’
‘Sounds serious,’ I said. ‘Go on.’

sense.def:
To go on about something
ali
to go on at someone
pomeni neprenehoma in dolgočasno govoriti;

seg.quote: Don't go on about it.
I went on at my father to have safety belts fitted.

sense.def:
Če določena dejavnost
is going on
, poteka.

seg.quote: There's a big argument going on.
A lot of cheating goes on.

sense.def:
‘Go on’
rečemo osebi, ki jo želimo k nečemu spodbuditi.

seg.quote: Go on, have a biscuit.

sense.def:
To go on a piece of information
pomeni ustvariti si mnenje na podlagi določenega podatka.

seg.quote: It's not much to go on.

sense.def:
Če neka naprava ali stroj
goes on
, začne delovati.

seg.quote: The light goes on automatically.

sense.def:
To go out with someone
pomeni pogosto preživljati čas v družbi neke osebe in imeti z njo ljubezenske ali spolne stike.

seg.quote: I went out with him a long time ago.

sense.def:
Če nekaj, kar ustvarja svetlobo ali toploto,
goes out
, preneha ustvarjati svetlobo ali toploto.

seg.quote: The lights went out in the big tent.
The fire went out.
My cigar's gone out.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
goes out
, preneha biti priljubljeno.

seg.quote: Steam went out and diesel was introduced.

sense.def:
To go over something
pomeni pozorno nekaj preučiti ali razmisliti.

seg.quote: He went over this in his mind.

sense.def:
To go over to a different method
pomeni izbrati drugo metodo.

seg.quote: We went over to the American system.

sense.def:
To go over to an organization
pomeni pridružiti se neki organizaciji, potem ko smo prej pripadali organizaciji, ki je temeljila na drugačnih zamislih.

seg.quote: Anyone joining the police is going over to the other side.

sense.def:
Če je dovolj nečesa
to go round
, je tistega dovolj za vse.

To go through an unpleasant event
pomeni doživeti neprijeten dogodek.

seg.quote: I'm too old to go through that again.

sense.def:
To go through a number of things
pomeni ogledati si vrsto stvari ali vsako po vrsti opisati.

seg.quote: Go through the files again.
You'd better go through the names.

sense.def:
Če neki zakon ali uradna odločitev
goes through
, je uradno odobrena.

seg.quote: The adoption went through.

sense.def:
To go through with something difficult or unpleasant
pomeni storiti nekaj zahtevnega ali neprijetnega.

seg.quote: Would he go through with the assassination?

sense.def:
Če neki znesek
goes towards something
, z njim delno krijemo stroške za neko stvar.

seg.quote: It will go towards a deposit on the flat.

sense.def:
Če neko podjetje
goes under
, propade.

Če neka količina ali raven
goes up
, se poveča.

seg.quote: The price of food will go up.

sense.def:
Kadar stavba
goes up
, jo postavijo.

Kadar nekaj
goes up
, eksplodira ali začne močno goreti.

seg.quote: In seconds it had gone up in flames.

sense.def:
Kadar ena stvar
goes with another
, vedno dobimo prvo stvar, če dobimo drugo.

cit.quote: spremljati, iti zraven; biti v paketu

seg.quote: The house went with the job.

sense.def:
To go without something
pomeni nečesa ne dobiti ali ne imeti.

seg.quote: If they couldn't get coal, they had to go without.
The family went without food all day.
